intro: Isopogon trilobus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf banksia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical flower spike. The plant produces dense, woody cones that contain numerous small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal and inland habitats. Isopogon trilobus is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays an important role in local ecosystems.
